body: Manhattan TRIBECA $2.1 million 76 Laight Street 3-bedroom, 3-bath, 2,200-sq.-ft. co-op in a renovated pre-World War II building; dining room, renovated kitchen, high ceilings, 4 exposures; maintenance $900, 50% tax-deductible; listed at $2.2 million, 1 week on market (broker: Sinvin Realty) MIDTOWN $775,000 136 East 56th Street 2-bedroom, 2-bath,
title: Residential Sales

body: When Imani Peterson's grandmother isn't feeling well, Imani gives her something no one else can. ''I sing to her,'' says Imani, 13. She sings gospel and jazz, opera, show tunes and punk rock. It is ''something I like to make people happy with,'' she says. For Imani, singing is not just a way to brighten her home; it is also a talent that has led
title: The Neediest Cases; A Teenager With a Voice Has a Vision for the Future

body: Colson Whitehead has a bouquet of reasons to be arrogant. He is a 33-year-old MacArthur ''genius award'' winner who has just published his first nonfiction book, an essay collection called ''The Colossus of New York: A City in 13 Parts.'' His first novel was critically acclaimed, and his second was a finalist for the Pulitzer Prize and the National
title: Singing the City Evanescent; A Writer Tries to Capture the Soul of an Ever-Shifting Metropolis

body: RONALD DELICE was born first, a full 10 seconds before his twin brother, Rony. On a Tuesday morning not too long ago, it was Ronald who led a tour of the brothers' live-and-work space, a mostly pumpkin-colored loft on Mercer Street in SoHo out of which they produce their men's-wear line, called, simply enough, Ron & Ron. On paper, it's Ronald's
title: Habitats/Mercer Street in SoHo; 1 Loft, 2 Businesses, Twins and 1 Marriage

body: EVENTS NEW YORK IRANIAN FILM FESTIVAL, Anthology Film Archives, 32-34 Second Avenue, at Second Street, East Village. A series of contemporary films continues through Sunday. Screenings tonight at 7:30 and 9:30; tomorrow at 5:30, 7:30 and 9:30 p.m.; and Sunday at 5:15, 7:15 and 9:30 p.m. Admission: $8; $5 for students. Information: (212) 505-5181.
title: SPARE TIMES

body: AS spring envelops the Northeast, show houses transformed by small armies of interior and landscape designers, and apartments and row houses offering a glimpse into history, are open to visitors. There are also tours of gardens large and small, including formal beds on estates and hidden urban courtyard gardens. Unless otherwise noted, all tours
title: Tours of Houses and Gardens: A Foot in the Door, for a Day
